properties.description: Grey Matters Active Ageing are keeping the older community in Helensburgh and Lomond warm and active this winter. They have a ‘Warm Welcome’ coffee morning every Tuesday at 10.30 and regular lunches both offering warm drinks/food and even warmer company. They also have over 14 interest groups to tap into during the week and are adding to them all the time including more evening and weekend activities too.
properties.title: Grey Matters Active Ageing

properties.description: Soup and bread will be served and tea/coffee will be available For more information call Christine on 07849 180129
properties.title: Live Argyll Helensburgh Library

properties.address: Gibson Hall, Main Road, Garelochhead G84 0AT
properties.description: Refreshments, raffle, chat, and various speakers. Following Thursdays: November 6th & 20th 2pm-4pm January 15th 2pm-4pm February 5th & 19th 2pm-4pm March 5th & 19th 2pm-4pm Membership £8 per annum. Call Evelyn: 07851 199 926 for information.
properties.title: Garelochhead Senior Citizens Club

properties.description: Anytime* the building is open, there is an area, the Gathering Space, with help yourself tea/coffee/hot water (free, cash donation welcome). Meeting Place: Tuesdays and Thursdays, 10.30 – 12.00. Tea/coffee and home baking – free, cash donations welcome. Worship on Wednesdays - Most weeks in the Small Hall, 12.30pm – a short service (30-40 minutes) followed by soup, tea/coffee and sweet. Free, cash donations welcome. No under 18’s without a responsible adult. *Occasionally closed for mid-week services in the church.
properties.title: The Bridge at Helensburgh Parish Church

properties.description: Lunch is also available at both the Community Cafe and Cafe n' Play by donation.

hours._text: Cafe n' Play for young children and their parents/guardians on Fridays 11.30am - 1.30pm. ; Community Cafe is open to everyone on Thursdays 11am - 1pm. ; Ability group sessions for adults with additional support needs Mondays and Tuesdays 11am-1pm.

properties.title: Centre 81

properties.address: Located above the MOD Police station in Churchill Square, Helensburgh G84 9HL

hours._text: The Family Hub - while the activities vary, offer morning and afternoon events. A warm welcome to anyone seeking a chat or a friendly cuppa!; Monday to Friday , with someone available in the office from 9am to 2.30pm.

properties.title: Home Start Lomond

properties.description: Blairmore Village Hall hosts a weekly “Drop in” on a Thursday morning. Called the Shore Hub, it is a warm and welcoming space for folk to go in for as long as they wish to. There is no charge, and if demand were sufficient, they could extend it to include a soup-and-sandwich lunch. 22 Kirk St,Dunoon, PA23 7DP Multiple days and times Live Argyll have launched their ‘Winter at the liveArgyll Libraries’ initiative, inviting people to use their libraries as warm spaces, and providing games, puzzles and as well as the use of library resources. You can find all information about this initiative here including opening times for the libraries taking part: Winter at the library - Live Argyll 17 – 21 John Street Dunoon, PA23 8BN The Anchor Tavern, 33 Marine Road, Port Bannatyne, Isle of Bute Everyone, including children are welcome! The soup is free but please give a donation if you can afford it so they can continue to help each other. You don’t need any particular reason to go other than fancying some food, some company and a bit of warmth. Hall Road, Lochgoilhead A warm space, hot meal and free internet access, open to all the Lochgoil community.

hours._text: From 11.00 on a Thursday. ; Monday 1-3pm ; Tuesday 10.30 - 1.30 ; Thursday 3.30 - 6pm ; Friday 9.30 - 12 ; Monday to Friday 9.00am to 5.00pm , as a warm space for 16- to 25-year-olds.; Lunch will be served at 1.00pm on Mon, Wed and Thursday . Tea, Coffee and Hot Chocolate will be available daily, and an activity programme will run, including Arts and crafts, pottery, sewing, cooking, and Movie afternoons. There is a computer and free internet access, and a pool table.; Wednesdays 3.30pm-5.30pm ; Monday 6-8pm

properties.title: Blairmore Village Hall

properties.description: Blairmore Village Hall hosts a weekly “Drop in” on a Thursday morning. Called the Shore Hub, it is a warm and welcoming space for folk to go in for as long as they wish to. There is no charge, and if demand were sufficient, they could extend it to include a soup-and-sandwich lunch.
